Message.Title: IBM did not miss its income and did not guide lower
Message.Msg: IBM is different from GOOG, INTC and MSFT who either missed or guided lower.

Topic.Title: IBM did not miss its income and did not guide lower

Message.Msg: No, they did not miss. With Apple and Google leading the way the market took one to the chin on Friday but IBM kept counter punching throughout the day. Expect IBM to set new highs in November.

Message.Title: Set a buy at $193
Message.Msg: looks like it will went thru late morning.
I wouldn't wait for 193.

Topic.Title: IBM did not miss its income and did not guide lower

Message.Msg: IBM is not GOOG or INTC to miss and then guide lower. IBM produces steady income per share. Although revenue was short of expectation because of new mainframe hardware/software release in Q4. In contrast to most big guys, IBM confirmed its guidance.
So does IBM itself. IBM buybacks its shares since it knows these are cheap prices.

Message.Title: IBM is producing stable income
Message.Msg: In contrast to other big techs, IBM income is stable with huge backlog.

Message.Title: IBM Should split
Message.Msg: we need a split 2:1

Message.Title: IBM Services backlog of $138 billion, up 1 percent in Q3 2012
Message.Msg: $138 B is a few years of revenue from services already locked in. That is why IBM is a gold standard compare to AAPL or GOOG when they may not produce in future while IBM will produce a steady income.

Message.Title: Here is IBM numbers for Q3 2012
Message.Msg: ARMONK, N.Y. - 16 Oct 2012: o Diluted EPS: - GAAP: $3.33, up 4 percent; $3.44, up 8 percent excluding UK pension-related charges; - Operating (non-GAAP): $3.62, up 10 percent; o Net income: - GAAP: $3.8 billion, flat; $3.9 billion, up 3 percent excluding UK pension-related charges; - Operating (non-GAAP): $4.2 billion, up 5 percent; o Gross profit margin: - GAAP: 47.4 percent, up 0.9 points; - Operating (non-GAAP): 48.1 percent, up 1.2 points; o Revenue: $24.7 billion, down 5 percent, down 2 percent adjusting for currency; - Negative currency impact of nearly $1 billion; - Divestiture of Retail Store Solutions (RSS) reduced revenue by 1 percent; o Software revenue down 1 percent, up 3 percent adjusting for currency; o Services revenue down 5 percent, flat adjusting for currency; o Services backlog of $138 billion, up 1 percent; o Systems and Technology revenue down 13 percent, down 12 percent adjusting for currency; o Growth markets revenue down 1 percent, up 4 percent adjusting for currency; - BRIC countries up 4 percent, up 11 percent adjusting for currency; o Business analytics revenue up 14 percent year to date; o Smarter Planet revenue up more than 20 percent year to date; o Cloud revenue year to date has exceeded full-year 2011 revenue; o Reiterating full-year 2012 operating (non-GAAP) EPS expectation of at least $15.10.

Message.Title: testing 190 this week on its way to 180 -170
Message.Msg: buy it back at 180, then you know it wont go down too much further...or will it?

Message.Title: Time to cut bait
Message.Msg: It's been good fishing with IBM, but, it's time to cut bait.

"It's been good fishing with IBM, but, it's time to cut bait." Ya know, that's just the kind of thing that Buffett might say to Charlie Munger. But that would only be the opener for Buffett. He would go on and give some reasons. It's easy to make some vague sweeping statement.

Topic.Title: testing 190 this week on its way to 180 -170

Message.Msg: Probably a good idea to wait according to the chart. There may be a bit of a head fake this week if AAPL and other big tech report good earnings, but the stock should see a short term bottom in the mid to low 180s. Very little risk into the end of the year at that price. That's when the momentum traders will come back in, after they wring out all the sellers.
You should have cut bait over 200! Probably not time to buy in yet, but you should be looking to buy if it drops into the 180s, not sell, at least for a trade.

Topic.Title: testing 190 this week on its way to 180 -170

Message.Msg: "Probably a good idea to wait according to the chart. There may be a bit of a head fake this week if AAPL and other big tech report good earnings, but the stock should see a short term bottom in the mid to low 180s. Very little risk into the end of the year at that price. That's when the momentum traders will come back in, after they wring out all the sellers." Quite a sermon. Did Jesus say this? Mere mortals who post as if the future is known are boring.

Message.Title: Greedy people who are timing the market will never win
Message.Msg: If $193 is not low enough then $185 is the same and the stock may never see $193 after today's close. A good investor buys in a few steps at different levels, $193 being one that should not be missed by any reason.

Message.Title: AAPL, the toy company is $23 up today
Message.Msg: Do you think that IBM stays this low? I do not think so since IBM business and income are more stable than AAPL.
Just curious. You had your chance, so did you make the leap. Good move if you did.

Topic.Title: AAPL, the toy company is $23 up today

Message.Msg: The toy company went public in 1980 and now has a market cap of $594 bil and $100 bil of cash. Apple could have done better. But as it is there has been no other wealth creation of that size and speed.

Topic.Title: Greedy people who are timing the market will never win

Message.Msg: I think we are up from here and you were wise if you jumped in at today's lows.

Topic.Title: testing 190 this week on its way to 180 -170

Message.Msg: As long as boring makes money, I'll stay boring all day long! By the way, terms like "probably", "may" and "should" is not knowing the future. Nothing is a certainly except that we are all mortal. It's just going with the trend, which usually works. I appreciate the differing view though.

Message.Title: $191.30 is the critical bottom
Message.Msg: I worker all weekend to come up with that figure. I hope its appreciated by all. I had to squueze in this work and me watching the Giants game and the Jets game almost suffered as I had to work on this after the games !....but alas, I came up with a resistance number that would worry even me if it is somehow breached.
Have you bought any bait lately? You better get it at today's prices, it's not getting any cheaper.
quite frankly.
Sooooooo , America has won the past 4 yrs ? I think not !!!!!
